tit.cmt: 抜けていたのでFUJIWARA no Tanetsugu を追加しました。

sen.j: 藤原 種継（ふじわら の たねつぐ、天平9年（737年）- 延暦4年9月24日 (旧暦)（785年11月4日））は奈良時代末期の公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu (737 - November 4, 785 in lunar calendar) was a court noble during the late Nara Period.
FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu (737 - November 4, 785 according to the lunar calendar) was a kuge (court noble) who lived during the late Nara Period.
FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu (737 - November 4, 785) was a kuge (court noble) who lived during the late Nara Period.
sen.cmt: according to the lunar calendar 削除

sen.j: 藤原式家の祖藤原宇合の孫。
sen.e: He was a grandson of FUJIWARA no Umakai, the forefather of the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan.
He was a grandson of FUJIWARA no Umakai, the forefather of the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan.
He was a grandson of FUJIWARA no Umakai, the forefather of the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 贈正一位藤原清成の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Kiyonari who was conferred Shoichii (Senior First Rank) posthumously.
He was the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Kiyonari, who was posthumously granted the rank of Shoichii (Senior First Rank).
He was the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Kiyonari, who was posthumously granted the rank of Shoichii (Senior First Rank).

sen.j: 正三位・中納言。
sen.e: Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) ・ Chunagon (Vice-councilor of State)
He held the rank of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and the position of Chunagon (Vice-councilor of State)
sen.cmt: A quick look at the actual Wikipedia article shows that this information is provided in the form of a paragraph, not as bullet points. Consequently, irrespective of the style used in the Japanese, full sentences should be used.
sen.e: He held the rank of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and the position of Chunagon (Vice-councilor of State)

sen.j: 贈位正一位・太政大臣。
sen.e: Shoichii ・ Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister), posthumously conferred
He was posthumously granted the rank of Shoichii (Senior First Rank) and the position of Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister).
He was posthumously granted the rank of Shoichii (Senior First Rank) and the position of Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister).

sen.j: 『続日本紀』では766年（天平神護2年）に従六位上から従五位下への昇進記事が初出で、同時に叙爵された人物に和気清麻呂がいる。
sen.e: According to the "Shoku Nihongi," he was first promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) from Jurokuinojo in 766 and WAKE no Kiyomaro was also given the same rank.
According to the "Shoku Nihongi," he was first promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) from Jurokuinojo in 766 and WAKE no Kiyomaro was also given the same rank.
According to the "Shoku Nihongi," he was first promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) from Jurokuinojo in 766 and WAKE no Kiyomaro was also given the same rank.

sen.j: 2年後には美作国守に、続いて近衛府少将・紀伊国守・山背守・京職・下総国守・左近衛兵督・近江国守を歴任する。
sen.e: Two years later, he became Mimasaka no kuni no kami (Governor of Mimasaka Province), and successively worked in different positions such as Konoefu shosho (Major General of the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Kii no kuni no kami (Governor of Kii Province), Yamashiro no kami (Governor of Yamashiro Province), a member of Kyoshiki (Capital Bureau), Shimousa no kuni no kami (Governor of Shimousa Province), Sakon hyoe no kami (Head of the Left Guards) and Omi no kuni no kami (Governor of Omi Province).
sen.cmt: 「左近衛兵督」は『左近兵衛督』の可能性があります。英語表記は『Sakon hyoe no kami』にしています。
sen.e: Two years later, he became Mimasaka no kuni no kami (Governor of Mimasaka Province), and successively worked in different positions such as Konoefu shosho (Major General of the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Kii no kuni no kami (Governor of Kii Province), Yamashiro no kami (Governor of Yamashiro Province), a member of Kyoshiki (Capital Bureau), Shimousa no kuni no kami (Governor of Shimousa Province), Sakon hyoe no kami (Head of the Left Guards) and Omi no kuni no kami (Governor of Omi Province).

Two years later, he became Mimasaka no kuni no kami (Governor of Mimasaka Province), and successively worked in different positions such as Konoefu shosho (Major General of the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Kii no kuni no kami (Governor of Kii Province), Yamashiro no kami (Governor of Yamashiro Province), a member of Kyoshiki (Capital Bureau), Shimousa no kuni no kami (Governor of Shimousa Province), Sakon hyoe no kami (Head of the Left Guards) and Omi no kuni no kami (Governor of Omi Province).

sen.j: 光仁天皇即位に尽力した式家の政治的な発言力が上昇するとともに、官位も上昇した。
sen.e: As the Shiki Family that worked for Emperor Konin's accession to the imperial throne became an influential political player, his official rank increased.
As the Shiki Family that worked for Emperor Konin's accession to the imperial throne became an influential political player, his official rank increased.
As the Shiki Family that worked for Emperor Konin's accession to the imperial throne became an influential political player, his official rank increased.

sen.j: 特に叔父である藤原良継・藤原百川の死後は、宇合の孫の中で最年長者であった種継が同家を代表する立場になった。
sen.e: After Tanetsugu's uncles FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu's and FUJIWARA no Momokawa's death, he who was the eldest person among Umakai's grandsons became the representative of that family.
sen.cmt: 「藤原良継・藤原百川」の「・」⇒『and』と解釈し英訳済み
sen.e: After Tanetsugu's uncles FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu's and FUJIWARA no Momokawa's death, as the eldest person among Umakai's grandsons he became the representative of that family.
After Tanetsugu's uncles FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu's and FUJIWARA no Momokawa's death, as the eldest person among Umakai's grandsons he became the representative of that family.

sen.j: 桓武天皇の信任も厚く782年（延暦元年）に参議・式部省、784年（同3年）には中納言となる。
sen.e: Emperor Kammu had a strong trust and confidence in Tanetsugu and he was given the position of Sangi (Councilor), Shikibu-sho (Ministry of Ceremonial) in 782 and became Chunagon (Middle Counselor) in 784.

Emperor Kammu had a strong trust and confidence in Tanetsugu and he was given the position of Sangi (Councilor), Shikibu-sho (Ministry of Ceremonial) in 782 and became Chunagon (Middle Counselor) in 784.

Emperor Kammu had a strong trust and confidence in Tanetsugu and he was given the position of Sangi (Councilor), Shikibu-sho (Ministry of Ceremonial) in 782 and became Chunagon (Middle Counselor) in 784.

tit.e: Transferring of the national capital to Nagaoka
Transferring of the national capital to Nagaoka
Transferring of the national capital to Nagaoka

sen.j: 784年、桓武は平城京からの遷都を望み、「天皇はなはだこれ（種継）を委任し、中外の事皆決を取る」とまで評されていた種継は、山城国乙訓郡長岡京市の地への遷都を提唱した。
sen.e: In 784 Emperor Kammu aspired to relocating the capital from Heijokyo (in current Nara) and remarked that "the Emperor really entrusts Tanetsugu with decision of entire internal and external matters," so Tanetsugu advised him about transferring of the national capital to Nagaoka, Otokuni District, Yamashiro Province.

In 784 Emperor Kammu aspired to relocate the capital from Heijokyo (in current Nara) and remarked that "the Emperor really entrusts Tanetsugu with decisions of entire internal and external matters," so Tanetsugu advised him about transferring the national capital to Nagaoka, Otokuni District, Yamashiro Province.

In 784 Emperor Kammu aspired to relocate the capital from Heijokyo (in current Nara) and remarked that 'the Emperor really entrusts Tanetsugu with decisions of entire internal and external matters,' so Tanetsugu advised him about transferring the national capital to Nagaoka, Otokuni District, Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 桓武の命をうけ藤原小黒麻呂・佐伯今毛人・紀船守・大中臣子老・坂上苅田麻呂らとともに長岡を視察し、同年長岡京の造宮使に任命される。
sen.e: With Emperor Kammu's order, Tanetsugu visited Nagaoka along with FUJIWARA no Oguromaro, SAEKI no Imaemishi, KI no Funamori, ONAKATOMI no Kooyu, SAKANOUE no Karitamaro and in the same year he was appointed the Zogushi (Palace construction officer) in Nagaokakyo (the ancient capital of Nagaoka).

With Emperor Kammu's order, Tanetsugu visited Nagaoka along with FUJIWARA no Oguromaro, SAEKI no Imaemishi, KI no Funamori, ONAKATOMI no Kooyu, SAKANOUE no Karitamaro and in the same year he was appointed the Zogushi (Palace construction officer) in Nagaokakyo (the ancient capital of Nagaoka).

With Emperor Kammu's order, Tanetsugu visited Nagaoka along with FUJIWARA no Oguromaro, SAEKI no Imaemishi, KI no Funamori, ONAKATOMI no Kooyu, SAKANOUE no Karitamaro and in the same year he was appointed the Zogushi (Palace construction officer) in Nagaokakyo (the ancient capital of Nagaoka).

sen.j: 事実上の遷都の責任者であった。
sen.e: He was in charge of the transfer of the capital.
He was in charge of the transfer of the capital.
He was in charge of the transfer of the capital.

sen.j: 遷都先である長岡が母の実家秦氏の根拠地山背国葛野郡に近いことから、造宮使に抜擢された理由の一つには秦氏の協力を得たいという思惑があった事も考えられる。
sen.e: One of the reasons why he was selected for Zogushi could be there were expectations for cooperation with the Hata clan, Tanetsugu's mother's family home, located in Kadono County, the Province of Yamashiro where was close to Nagaoka, the place transferred the capital.

One of the reasons why he was selected for Zogushi could be that there were expectations for cooperation with the Hata clan, Tanetsugu's mother's family home, located in Kadono County, the Province of Yamashiro which was close to Nagaoka, the place where the capital was transferred to.

One of the reasons why he was selected for Zogushi could be that there were expectations for cooperation with the Hata clan, Tanetsugu's mother's family home, located in Kadono County, the Province of Yamashiro which was close to Nagaoka, the place where the capital was transferred to.

sen.j: 実際、秦足長や大秦宅守など秦氏一族の者は造宮に功があったとして叙爵されている。
sen.e: In fact, the Hata family's members including HATA no Tarinaga and UZUMASA no Yakamori were conferred a peerage for the success of building Shinto shrines.
In fact, the Hata family's members including HATA no Tarinaga and UZUMASA no Yakamori were conferred a peerage for the success of building Shinto shrines.
In fact, the Hata family's members including HATA no Tarinaga and UZUMASA no Yakamori were conferred a peerage for the success of building Shinto shrines.

tit.e: An assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu
The assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu
The assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu

sen.j: 遷都後間もない785年（延暦4年）旧暦9月23日夜、種継は造宮監督中に矢で射られ、翌日亡くなった。
sen.e: Soon after the transfer of the capital, on the evening of September 23rd in 785, Tanetsugu was shot with an arrow when overseeing the construction and tehn he died in the next day.
sen.cmt: 『夜』の時間帯 ⇒『the evening』で解釈＆英訳済み
sen.e: Soon after the transfer of the capital, on the evening of September 23rd in 785, Tanetsugu was shot with an arrow when overseeing the construction and died the following day.
Soon after the transfer of the capital, on the evening of September 23rd in 785, Tanetsugu was shot with an arrow when overseeing the construction and died the following day.

sen.j: 桓武天皇が大和国に出かけた留守の間の事件だった。
sen.e: It occurred while Emperor Kammu was away for Yamato Province.
It occurred while Emperor Kammu was away in Yamato Province.
It occurred while Emperor Kammu was away in Yamato Province.

sen.j: 暗殺犯として大伴竹良らがまず逮捕され、取調べの末大伴継人・佐伯高成ら十数名が捕縛されて首を斬られた。
sen.e: OTOMO no Takera was arrested on suspicion of assassination first, and after an investigation, more than a dozen people including OTOMO no Tsuguhito and SAEGI Takanari were captured and decapitated.
OTOMO no Takera was arrested on suspicion of assassination first, and after an investigation, more than a dozen people including OTOMO no Tsuguhito and SAEGI Takanari were captured and decapitated.
OTOMO no Takera was arrested on suspicion of assassination first, and after an investigation, more than a dozen people including OTOMO no Tsuguhito and SAEGI Takanari were captured and decapitated.

sen.j: 事件直前の旧暦8月28日に死去した大伴家持は首謀者として官籍から除名された。
sen.e: OTOMO no Yakamochi who died on August 28th on the lunar calendar just before the fact was divested of his court rank as the ringleader.
sen.cmt: 「官籍」解釈不可 ⇒ 『his court rank』と暫定的に英訳
sen.e: OTOMO no Yakamochi who died on August 28th on the lunar calendar just before he was divested of his court rank as the ringleader.
OTOMO no Yakamochi who died on August 28th on the lunar calendar just before he was divested of his court rank as the ringleader.

sen.j: 事件に連座して配流となった者も五百枝王・藤原雄依・紀白麻呂・大伴永主など複数にのぼった。
sen.e: With being implicated in the fact, several people including IOE no Okimi, FUJIWARA no Oyori, KI no Shiromaro and OTOMO no Naganushi were exiled.
Implicated by the facts, several people including IOE no Okimi, FUJIWARA no Oyori, KI no Shiromaro and OTOMO no Naganushi were exiled.
Implicated by the facts, several people including IOE no Okimi, FUJIWARA no Oyori, KI no Shiromaro and OTOMO no Naganushi were exiled.

sen.j: その後、事件は桓武天皇の皇太子であった弟早良親王の廃嫡、配流と憤死にまで発展する。
sen.e: After that, the fact developed that Imperial Prince Sawara who was Emperor Kammu's younger brother and the Crown Prince was disinherited and then later expelled and died in exile.
Later Imperial Prince Sawara who was Emperor Kammu's younger brother and the Crown Prince was disinherited and then later expelled and died in exile.
Later Imperial Prince Sawara who was Emperor Kammu's younger brother and the Crown Prince was disinherited and then later expelled and died in exile.

sen.j: もともと種継と早良親王は不仲であったとされているが、早良が実際に事件にかかわっていたのかどうかは真偽が定かでない。
sen.e: It is said that Imperial Prince Sawara had been on bad terms with Tanetsugu; however the truth is not sure whether Sawara was involved in the fact.
It is said that Imperial Prince Sawara had been on bad terms with Tanetsugu; however the truth is not sure whether Sawara was involved in the fact.
It is said that Imperial Prince Sawara had been on bad terms with Tanetsugu; however the truth is not sure whether Sawara was involved in the fact.

sen.j: しかし家持は生前春宮大夫であり、高成や他の逮捕者の中にも皇太子の家政機関である春宮坊の官人が複数いたことは事実である。
sen.e: However, Yakamochi was Togu no daibu (Master of the Crown Prince's Quarters) before his death and it is true that Takanari and those who arrested also included some government officials of Togubo that was the domestic governing institution for Crown Prince.

However, Yakamochi was Togu no daibu (Master of the Crown Prince's Quarters) before his death and it is true that Takanari and those who were arrested also included some government officials of Togubo which was the domestic governing institution for Crown Prince.

However, Yakamochi was Togu no daibu (Master of the Crown Prince's Quarters) before his death and it is true that Takanari and those who were arrested also included some government officials of Togubo which was the domestic governing institution for Crown Prince.

sen.j: その後長岡京から平安京へ短期間のうちに遷都することになったのは、後に早良親王が怨霊として恐れられるようになった事も含めて、この一連の事件が原因のひとつになったといわれている。
sen.e: Relocating the capital from Nagaoka-Kyo to Heian-Kyo (in current Kyoto) in a short time could be attributed in part to a series of the events including avoiding the vengeful ghost of the Imperial Prince Sawara.

Relocating the capital from Nagaoka-Kyo to Heian-Kyo (in current Kyoto) in a short time could be attributed in part to a series of the events including avoiding the vengeful ghost of the Imperial Prince Sawara.

Relocating the capital from Nagaoka-Kyo to Heian-Kyo (in current Kyoto) in a short time could be attributed in part to a series of the events including avoiding the vengeful ghost of the Imperial Prince Sawara.

sen.j: 種継は死後、桓武天皇により正一位・左大臣が贈られ、には太政大臣が贈られた。
sen.e: After Tanetsugu's death, Emperor Kammu gave him Shoichii (Senior First Rank) and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) and then Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister) in 809.
sen.cmt: 「正一位・左大臣」の「・」は『and』と解釈し英訳済み「…が贈られ、には太政大臣が贈られた。」の「には」の前には『809年』が入ると解釈し、『in 809』を追加
sen.e: After Tanetsugu's death, Emperor Kammu made him Shoichii (Senior First Rank) and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) and then Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister) in 809.
After Tanetsugu's death, Emperor Kammu made him Shoichii (Senior First Rank) and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) and then Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister) in 809.
